title: The Deadly Assassin
dialogue_triumphs: Vaporisation without representation is against the constitution!
I deny this reality. The reality is a computation matrix.
As I believe I told you long ago, Doctor, you will never amount to anything in the galaxy while you retain your propensity for vulgar facetiousness.
If heroes don't exist, it is necessary to invent them
dialogue_disasters: You weak fool! You craven-hearted spineless poltroon!
goofs: Eric Chitty: 'Thank you for helping us defeat the Baster.'

continuity_notes.name: Castellan
continuity_notes.description: Head of Capitol security on Gallifrey

continuity_notes.name: Matrix
continuity_notes.description: Part of the Amplified Panotropic Computer net on Gallifrey

continuity_notes.name: Artron energy
continuity_notes.description: Energy associated with time travel, possibly powering TARDISes
continuity_notes.current_status: Mentioned as being unusually high in the Doctor

continuity_notes.name: Time Lord Chapters
continuity_notes.description: Different sects of Time Lords, including Prydonians, Arcalians, and Patrexes

continuity_notes.name: Borusa
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's old tutor, recently became a Cardinal

continuity_notes.name: The Master
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord renegade and the Doctor's nemesis
continuity_notes.current_status: Using a matter condensation device, met Chancellor Goth on Tersurus

technobabble: The Doctor's TARDIS is a type 40 (obsolete) protected by a 'double-curtain trimonic barrier' which requires a 'cypher-indent key'.
The Master uses tricophenylaldehyde (a neural inhibitor) to feign death.
links: The Doctor's trial in 'The War Games' was dated 309906, his sentence was remitted by the CIA (Celestial Intervention Agency)

locations.name: Gallifrey
locations.description: Home planet of the Time Lords
locations.current_status: Active, center of Time Lord civilization

qv: The Location of Gallifrey, 'Terror of the Autons'
additional_notes: The episode introduces many concepts about Time Lord society and Gallifrey that become cornerstone elements of the series. It also features a controversial sequence of the Doctor's journey into the APC net, which takes up a significant portion of the middle episodes.
bottom_line: A complete rewrite of the series' format, 'The Deadly Assassin' is the definitive text on the Time Lords. Politically literate and cynical, the serial is known for its violence and revelations about the Doctor's people and their culture.
